bibl.title: Larichos in the Brothers Poem: Sappho Speaks Truth to the Wine-Pourer.
The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2

bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - Sappho gives us a miniature drama of a sister trying to persuade her brother (Larichos) to face a threat to family well-being and respond with action: the poem is not really about wealth per se but about acting rather than assuming the gods' favor.
